website_summaries.verdict: The unique Blue Sadie headphones are bulky, but beautiful, and deliver a rich, clear audio experience.
pros: Built-in amplifier for powerful audio performance with rich lows and bright, clear highs
Ships with two removable cables, one with an inline mic
Can be used in passive mode

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Nice Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These are seriously nice headphones. I use them for professional music mixing so I can hear what my mixes will sound like on consumer gear. There are 3 choices of amplification (off, on, and bass boost). Bass boost is particularly useful to hear what your music will sound like on "hyped" systems. The amped selections do have a bit of hiss but livable. A real nice feature is the headphones will automatically turn off when you take them off your head - saving the battery. They charge via USB. They are comfortable and seal out the rest of the room quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: NikNo

customer_reviews.title: Just another level in music sound
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful sound ,I’m not a audiophile but I love my music ,I want to here my music the best I can with all my portable devices I have a few open back headphones these come close to the sound but better bass this have,just my opinion from someone who love rap, pop, and metal
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap - don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these even though there were some negative reviews on the quality. Wish I would have listened to the negative reviews. Headphones have great audio when they work. The switch was so poor quality that after a couple of weeks the headphones were unusable. There were supposed to be three power settings, but in reality there was only one location - in between clicks on the knob -where the headphones actually worked. Otherwise it was sound out of one side or no sound at all.
customer_reviews.author: StefD

customer_reviews.title: GREAT heaphones
customer_reviews.text: These are a fantastic deal, and sound amazing even with just using a PC's 3.5mm jack. The internal amp does a great job at amplifying the sound and adding a little extra bass when on the On+ setting. They are very clear and when listening to good quality files produce some great sound. They can get VERY loud, so be careful. Well worth the money! The reason for the 4 stars on the comfort, is they can get a little heavy over time and you notice they are there. It's not uncomfortable by any means, you just get more aware the longer you have them on
customer_reviews.author: Scott Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional comfort and sound out of even phones!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! Just WOW!! I don't know what else to say about the sound of these babies. I love high end music with crisp, clean, bright and very detailed sound quality. Blue Sadie deliver in all these departments!! I use an iPod touch fifth generation with them and I'm blown away. Excellent sound. Build quality seems very solid and the comfort is amazing!! So glad I purchased these and listened to my friends recommending these lovelies. Hope they hold up over time, cause I'm in love with Sadie 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loud on the go.
customer_reviews.text: I pretty much just bought this for my Nintendo switch. I wanted more volume at certain points in the games, all my other headphones i was maxing out the volume. I cant get past 50% volume while the amp in this thing is on. I only use the switch in portable mode, so there are really no options for a headphone amps. If you want an all in one easy solution for all the volume you need this is your product.
customer_reviews.author: Bobafeet

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: A tad heavy for me but they sound great. At 160 these are an absolute steal. Really pretty and we'll engineered headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Audionerd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fidelity
customer_reviews.text: First of all the fidelity of these headphones is incredible. The transience is so good you can hear singers draw breath before they sing. The separation is good. I bought these headphones for isolation during broadcasts. They are comfortable because they are oval shaped and fit around your ear not resting on it.
customer_reviews.author: Todd R. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says and does it with style.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones do everything they claim and do it in style. Coupled with the line out on a good dac provide true audiophile sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: RMW

customer_reviews.title: Unique
customer_reviews.text: This is one of its kind on the price. The way the size changes through easy adjustment. It is easy for me because I know how mechanics work to figure out the sweat spot instantly when putting the headset on. I tend to use an amp, so this headset works just fine. But if you are taking it out with a laptop or phone that doesnt have good DAC, then this does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Cednonymous

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE!!!?
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best headphones I’ve ever purchased. I’m no expert or clam to know everything there is to know about specs but after seeing a number of reviews and wanting to get the most out of my music I made the move. From the moment you put them on the feel is great and before you even turn on the amp this headphones have awesome sound quality. They drown out everything around you and I’m able to get lost in every sound i love them! If you have the money to invest do so it is worth every penny!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Velasco

customer_reviews.title: Excellent if you need a loud sound
customer_reviews.text: I like this unit because it's great for amplifying the sound of games on the PC.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Lacks compatible quality
customer_reviews.text: Lacked quality features and audio. On and off knob is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Jon@Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Saving $200 plus dollars is usually a great deal!
customer_reviews.text: The look is incredibly pleasing! The adjustment knob for the amplified sound is not to sturdy and I should have paid for the warranty extension, but I’m happy thus far. Just keeping my fingers crossed!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones to date
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely amazing. easily the best pair of headphones I've ever purchased like ever. The bass is insane, I'm a bass head and I still think it has too much bass but I love it. Keep up the good work blue!
customer_reviews.author: baker albassam

customer_reviews.title: The blues headphones always had premium sound high-level Base Great High great mids I only wish they come out ...
customer_reviews.text: The blues headphones always had premium sound high-level Base Great High great mids I only wish they come out with her just the same quality Bluetooth
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Reams

customer_reviews.title: Headband came apart in a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Unusable after a few months. First the switch that controls the amp was touch and had to be adjusted just right for the sound to come out of both speakers. Then after 3 months the headband came apart at the hinge. Never dropped never damaged. Sent a message to their support team. Wil update this review depending on their reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Kritical

customer_reviews.title: Quality doesn’t match price tag.
customer_reviews.text: These feel and sound like they should be 200$ or less. Ear pads are made with cheap material, the internal battery for the “amplifier “ doesn’t hold a charge which doesn’t matter since the “amplifier” doesn’t work and never has worked correctly. I’m extremely dissatisfied and even more so after my interaction with the company Blue in their response when I emailed them about the amp not working altogether, they shrugged me off and offered no solution. They were less than a month old at that time.
customer_reviews.author: Abstract Visionz Tie Dye

customer_reviews.title: Oh my Lordy Lord.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my Lordy Lord. Long After You're Gone (High Quality) Audiophiles Music ... just saying look it up on you tube and enjoy with these. The amplifier is wonderful. The sound isn't as wide as my AKG 702s but the sound is so pleasing and deep and present. I want to just sit and listen. The cups wrap you in your own world. You don't need noise cancelling. Can't hear a darn thing outside these phones. Really wonder what the more expensive versions of these sound like. But 400 bucks is steep enough for me. Can't wait until these things break in, another 100 hours should get closer to the real sound. But out of box I really like these.
customer_reviews.author: Yadiloh

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE PHONES!
customer_reviews.text: It says that the Sadie's were formerly the mo-fi's. This is not true. This is a new pair of phones, very similar, but not the mo-fi's. That being said these are a wonderful pair of headphones, built-in amps like the mo-fi's. Amazing transparency and able to reproduce some amazing lows and high's. If you are looking for a pair of nearfield speakers that you can wear on your head.... This is what you need. They also isolate (not noise-cancel) very well. Easy to use in a session or on a mix stage.
customer_reviews.author: Debora

customer_reviews.title: These Headphones Have Saved My Life (so far)
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Mo-Fi`s back when they first came out.Up until that point it was a never ending search and purchases of over- ear phones that had enough bass response.I believe they are exceptional in this regard as well as overall performance and design at this price range.I would still be using them had the screws holding the cup to the band not come out.Tried to fix but that didnt go well and wont for you either if you try.Very tiny complicated inner workings. Buy the Asurion 4-year protection plan just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wood

customer_reviews.title: Clean and confertable headset
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Sound better than my Pro Shure phones. Better highs and not overly bassey. Works nice even when the battery runs down. Only thing found is the volume drops a lot but no loss of clarity and sweetness. Only worry is in a few years replacing the battery. Nothing in the manual about how.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

product_meta.title: Blue Sadie Premium Headphones with Built-in Amp, Black (7068)
product_meta.description: Nowadays, you probably listen to more music on your laptop and phone than anywhere else. Ironically, those devices have weak, noisy audio outputs that really aren’t made for music. That inspired us to reimagine the modern headphone and design it around a built-in audiophile amplifier, which delivers dynamic, detailed and clear sound-no matter what you’re plugged into. Sadie is the evolution of the ultimate listening experience first pioneered by Blue’s groundbreaking Mo-Fi powered headphones. By further refining Blue’s revolutionary fit and sonic soundstage, Sadie delivers even higher levels of performance to reveal new details in your favorite music. The result is a headphone that makes every device sound like a big home hi-fi system. You won’t believe how much music you’ve been missing.
feature_bullets: Built-in audiophile amplifier for true high-fidelity sound on any device
50 millimeter drivers custom-tuned for a superior soundstage
Sealed over-ear design for immersive isolation
Racecar-inspired multi-jointed headband design keeps ear cups parallel at all times for superior comfort and sound
Powers on and off automatically when headphones are opened and closed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars55 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
